title: VR-Based Intensive Neuroanatomy Learning Program

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational medical terminology and human anatomy understanding
context.additional_context: Intensive Course on Core Neuroanatomical Concepts for Training Medical Interpreters in the Fourth Industrial Revolution Era

learning_goals: Learners can identify 3D forms of major brain structures (e.g., cerebral cortex, hippocampus, hypothalamus) with 90% accuracy in VR environments
Learners can explain neuron signal transmission processes in three or more stages using neuroanatomical terminology
Learners can analyze brain injury cases through VR simulations and describe clinical implications with 70% accuracy
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
